citation.article-title: Nocardioides hankookensis sp. nov., isolated from soil.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Nocardioides hankookensis sp. nov.
Nocardioides hankookensis (han.koo.ken′sis. N.L. masc. adj. hankookensis of Hankook, the Korean name for South Korea, from where the type strain was isolated).
Cells are aerobic, non-spore-forming, non-motile, curved or straight rods (0.4–0.8×1.5–10.0 μm) in the exponential phase of growth.
Cells do not show rod-to-coccus morphogenesis from the early exponential phase to the stationary phase.
Gram-positive, but Gram-variable in old cultures.
Colonies on R2A agar are circular to slightly irregular with entire margins, convex, smooth, glistening, white in colour and 0.7–1.0 mm in diameter after 7 days incubation on R2A agar at 25 °C.
Neither substrate nor aerial mycelium is formed.
Growth occurs at 10 and 34 °C, but not at 4 or 35 °C.
Optimal pH for growth is 6.0–7.0.
Growth occurs at pH 5.5 and 8.0, but not at pH 5.0 or 8.5.
Growth occurs in the presence of 0–2 % (w/v) NaCl, with an optimum at 0–0.5 % (w/v) NaCl.
Arginine dihydrolase, lysine decarboxylase, ornithine decarboxylase and tryptophan deaminase are absent.
H2S and indole are not produced.
Tweens 20, 40 and 60 are hydrolysed.

Susceptible to the following antibiotics (μg per disc, unless indicated otherwise): carbenicillin (100), chloramphenicol (100), gentamicin (30), kanamycin (30), lincomycin (15), neomycin (30), oleandomycin (15), polymyxin B (100 U), streptomycin (50) and tetracycline (30).
Resistant to the following antibiotics (μg per disc, unless indicated otherwise): ampicillin (10), cephalothin (30), novobiocin (5) and penicillin G (20 U).
The diagnostic diamino acid in the cell-wall peptidoglycan is ll-2,6-diaminopimelic acid.
The predominant menaquinone is MK-8(H4).
The major fatty acids (>10 % of total fatty acids) are iso-C16 : 0, C17 : 1ω8c and C18 : 1ω9c.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 71.3 mol% (determined by HPLC).
Other phenotypic characteristics are given in Table 1.
The type strain, DS-30T (=KCTC 19246T =CCUG 54522T), was isolated from soil from Dokdo, an island of Korea.
